text.p: Tropical Cyclone 06B in the Bay of Bengal is located near 17.9N/86.8E and packing winds near 55 mph. This storm is tracking off to the northeast at 8 mph and is expected to reach the coast of Bangladesh sometine Wednesday morning. rain, gusty winds, and localized flooding will affect northeastern India and Bangladesh as the storm approaches.

Tropical Cyclone 05A is in the eastern Arabian Sea and drfting to the south southwest. Top winds are 40 mph. This system will be a threat mostly to shipping as it is expected to dissipated before reaching land.
THERE ARE NO FURTHER EMERGENCY STATEMENTS AT THIS TIME
